javaslang.algebra

Interface Monad<M extends Kind1<M,?>,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - Type M<?> of a monadic instance, which is covered by this Monad
    T - component type of this monad
    All Superinterfaces:
    Functor<T>

    public interface Monad<M extends Kind1<M,?>,T>
extends Functor<T>
    Defines a Monad by generalizing the flatMap function.

    A Monad is a Functor with a flatMap method that satisfies the Monad laws, also known as the three control laws:

    Let

    • A, B, C be types
    • unit: A -> Monad<A> a constructor
    • f: A -> Monad<B>, g: B -> Monad<C> functions
    • a be an object of type A
    • m be an object of type Monad<A>
    Then all instances of the Monad interface should obey the three control laws:
    • Left identity: unit(a).flatMap(f) ≡ f a
    • Right identity: m.flatMap(unit) ≡ m
    • Associativity: m.flatMap(f).flatMap(g) ≡ m.flatMap(x -> f.apply(x).flatMap(g))
    To read further about monads in Java please refer to What's Wrong in Java 8, Part IV: Monads.
    Since:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Daniel Dietrich

      Represents a function (T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6) -> R lifted to (M<T1>, M<T2>, M<T3>, M<T4>, M<T5>, M<T6>) -> M<R>.

      Represents a function (T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7) -> R lifted to (M<T1>, M<T2>, M<T3>, M<T4>, M<T5>, M<T6>, M<T7>) -> M<R>.

      Represents a function (T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8) -> R lifted to (M<T1>, M<T2>, M<T3>, M<T4>, M<T5>, M<T6>, M<T7>, M<T8>) -> M<R>.

    • Method Detail

      • flatMap

        <U> Monad<M,U> flatMap(Function<? super T,? extends Monad<M,U>> mapper)
        FlatMaps this Monad to a new Monad with different component type.

        FlatMap is the sequence operation for functions and behaves like the imperative ;.

        If the previous results are needed, flatMap cascades: 

         
 m1().flatMap(result1 ->
      m2(result1).flatMap(result2 ->
          m3(result1, result2).flatMap(result3 ->
              ...
          )
      )
 );
        If only the last result is needed, flatMap may be used sequentially: 
         
 m1().flatMap(this::m2)
     .flatMap(this::m3)
     .flatMap(...);
        Type Parameters:
        U - Component type of the mapped Monad
        Parameters:
        mapper - A mapper
        Returns:
        a mapped Monad
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if mapper is null

      • narrow

        Kind1<M,T> narrow()
        Pulls the monadic instance of type M<?> out of this Monad view. This instance can be safely casted to type M<T>.
        Returns:
        the monadic instance wrapped by this Monad
